drug.name: Gusperimus
drug.description: Gusperimus has been used in trials studying the treatment of Lupus Nephritis, Wegeners Granulomatosis, and Wegener's Granulomatosis.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as n-acyl-alpha amino acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing an alpha amino acid (or a derivative thereof) which bears an acyl group at its terminal nitrogen atom.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Denosumab
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Denosumab is combined with Gusperimus.

drug-interaction.name: Natalizumab
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Gusperimus is combined with Natalizumab.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Pimecrolimus is combined with Gusperimus.

drug-interaction.name: Roflumilast
drug-interaction.description: Roflumilast may increase the immunosuppressive activities of Gusperimus.

drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Sipuleucel-T can be decreased when used in combination with Gusperimus.
